greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A233271(n) - A179016(n).
comment: Except for a(2)=-1 (which seems to be the only negative term in the sequence), the sequences A218600 and A213710 give the positions of zeros.

Furthermore, each subrange [A213710(n)..A218600(n+1)] is palindromic. A233268 gives the middle points of those ranges, the sequence A234018 gives the values at those points, while A234019 gives the maximum term in that range in this sequence.
formula: a(A218602(n)) = a(n). [This is just a claim that each row is palindrome]
example: After zero, each row n is A213709(n-1) elements long.
xref: Except for a(2)=-1 (which seems to be the only negative term in the sequence), the sequences A218600 and A213710 give the positions of zeros.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 14 2013
